definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: The land has appreciated greatly since the new railway was buit.
sentences.chinese: 自从新铁路筑成以后，这块地的价值大为增高。

sentences.english: To my amazement, he was able to recite the poem from memory.
sentences.chinese: 令我大为惊奇的是，他把这首诗从头到尾背了出来。

sentences.english: The last part is an analysis of the grandness-orientation in aesthetics.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分则对汉赋以大为美的价值取向进行了分析。

sentences.english: The appearance of the whale has stunned marine biologists.
sentences.chinese: 这头灰鲸的让海洋生物学家大为吃惊。

sentences.english: The fact that she was furious to find less left vent.
sentences.chinese: 这令她大为光火，去找左少发泄。

sentences.english: Why may Fan Bing Bing and Tong Da Wei perform such TV?
sentences.chinese: 为什么范冰冰和佟大为会出演这样的电视呢？

sentences.english: Thus, operations of solving the equation and inner storage capacity are greatly reduced.
sentences.chinese: 从而使解方程的计算工作量和内贮容量大为减少。
她的厚颜使我大为吃惊。

sentences.english: A fresh coat of paint transformed the room.
sentences.chinese: 房间粉刷一遍大为改观。

sentences.english: The equipment is improved greatly in automation level and reduces quantity of adhesives.
sentences.chinese: 此设备自动化程度大为提高，且降低了涂胶量。

sentences.english: That put the whole office in a tizzy.
sentences.chinese: 那事使全办公室的人都大为惊讶。

sentences.english: A few simple modifications to this plan would greatly improve it.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划只要略作几处简单修改便可大为改善。

sentences.english: The umpire lost his cap and his cool.
sentences.chinese: 裁判员丢了帽子，大为激动。

sentences.english: The scandal he was involved in before detracts his from great glorious.
sentences.chinese: 他以往卷入的那件丑问已使他的光辉业绩大为失色。

sentences.english: The widespread availability of free or very low cost development tools makes creating a business almost scarily simple.
sentences.chinese: 遍布的免费或着低成本的发展工具使创业大为简单化。

sentences.english: She had a shock and conked out.

definition: to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
to be pleased beyond one's expectations (idiom)/overjoyed at the turn of events
to feel even more/to be extremely (sad, lonely, delighted etc)
to listen/to hear what sb says/news one has heard
